intro: Linaria oligantha subsp. oligantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in open areas such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
